snippet: The foreign ministers of Japan and the Philippines proclaimed their nations to be strategic partners that would collaborate more in resolving their separate territorial disputes with China.
abstract: Japan and the Philippines agree to cooperate more closely on maritime security, sign of how China's rise has turned former wartime foes into allies; Japanese Prime Min Shinzo Abe has also vowed to strengthen security ties with other democracies in region to offset China's growing power.
lead_paragraph: The foreign ministers of Japan and the Philippines proclaimed their nations to be strategic partners that would collaborate more in resolving their separate territorial disputes with China.

headline.seo: Japan and Philippines to Bolster Maritime Cooperation
headline.main: To Counter China, Japan and Philippines Will Bolster Maritime Cooperation
headline.print_headline:
Japan: Deal Reached With Philippines
As a Security Counterweight to China
